Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with traces of two pairs of added white bands; exterior: handle zone pattern consisting of double guilloche band between black bands; below, single black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes compares this sherd with Tocra Type III, which are Chalice Style, not Mature Animal Style vases. Lemos chooses to place the sherd in the Mature Animal Style but the lack of filling ornament is only consistent with the later phase of that style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 266, no. 593)
Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 206-7, no. N17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1180) (phase 2)
